intro: Tragacantha bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteous tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its roots are known to secrete a gum similar to tragacanth, which has historical uses in medicine and industry. Tragacantha bracteosa is typically found in grassland and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
